interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Whirlpool
Review Date: 2011/10/10
Store: Gene Tierney  (Actor),     Richard Conte  (Actor),     Otto Preminger  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', "A hypnotist frames a psychiatrist's kleptomaniac wife for murder. Directed by Otto Preminger.", 'Amazon.com', 'Laura', 'will always be director Otto Preminger\'s most beloved movie, but he gets closer to the essence of film noir in this fascinatingly slippery item about a psychiatrist\'s wife whose weakness for kleptomania makes her prey to an oily hypnotist, con artist, and manipulator par excellence. The fashion-plate wife (dresses, robes, and peignoirs by Oleg Cassini) is played by Laura herself, Gene Tierney. The mellifluous conniver is Jose Ferrer, coming off like the illegitimate son of Waldo Lydecker ("I\'m so glad you\'re here--you make Tina\'s party seem an almost human event"). Among other things, Ferrer would probably like to get Tierney into bed, and a good many people--including Richard Conte as the caring husband--come to believe he has. But that\'s not the extent of his ambitions, and before long Tierney has been framed for a murder of convenience to clear up another bit of messiness in the cad\'s career.', 'Whirlpool', "'s mise-en-scène has a sinuous fluidity and subtle play of light and shadow (it was among the last films shot by that master of black-and-white, Arthur C. Miller), and the complexly structured screenplay--by Ben Hecht and Andrew Solt--takes us by surprise in reel after reel. There's nothing redeeming about Ferrer's character (except how much pleasure his villainy affords), but Preminger doesn't really side with any of the characters or permit our facile identification with anyone. Different parts of the movie are dominated by each of the key figures, including police detective Charles Bickford, and we keep learning there's more to each of them than we initially assumed.", 'Whirlpool', "'s a good title for it. Dive in.", '--Richard T. Jameson']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dubbed, Black & White, Full Screen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': "Gene Tierney, Otto Preminger, Andrew Solt, Eduard Franz, Barbara O'Neil, Guy Endore, Charles Bickford, Gail Bonney, Beau Anderson, Constance Collier, Jos Ferrer, Fortunio Bonanova, Richard Conte, Ben Hecht, Myrtle Anderson, Lovyss BradleyGene Tierney, Otto Preminger, Andrew Solt, Eduard Franz, Barbara O'Neil, Guy Endore, Charles Bickford, Gail Bonney, Beau Anderson, Constance Collier, Jos Ferrer, Fortunio Bonanova, Richard Conte, Ben Hecht, Myrtle Anderson, Lovyss Bradley  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Director': 'Otto Preminger', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dubbed, Black & White, Full Screen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 6, 2005', 'Actors': "Gene Tierney, Richard Conte, Jos Ferrer, Charles Bickford, Barbara O'Neil", 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Andrew Solt, Ben Hecht, Guy Endore', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The best thing about this DVD is the quality and the commentary.  When you listen to the commentary the film is much more interesting.  Just watching it, well, it is not a very interesting or exciting film.  I was curious because I had not heard of it or seen it.  If I had seen it before, I may not have purchased it.  Good performances.
Review Title: Not Preminger's Best
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

The best thing about this DVD is the quality and the commentary.  When you listen to the commentary the film is much more interesting.  Just watching it, well, it is not a very interesting or exciting film.  I was curious because I had not heard of it or seen it.  If I had seen it before, I may not have purchased it.  Good performances.
Not Preminger's Best
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences**: The user shows a strong interest in classic films, particularly in the drama genre, with a specific focus on works by renowned directors and actors. The presence of notable figures such as Otto Preminger and Gene Tierney indicates a preference for classic cinema and its historical value.

- **Viewing Expectations**: The user values the quality of film production, including aspects such as sound quality and visual presentation. They appreciate additional commentary that enhances the viewing experience, suggesting a desire for deeper engagement with the content.

- **Critical Perspective**: The user exhibits a critical view towards films, looking beyond surface enjoyment to evaluate aspects like storytelling and character development. Their review indicates they are discerning, as they describe the film as "not very interesting" while still acknowledging good performances.

- **Experience Over Popularity**: The decision to purchase despite not prior knowledge of the film reflects a curiosity about lesser-known works, prioritizing personal discovery over mainstream popularity.

- **Engagement with Film History**: The user displays an appreciation for film history, indicated by interest in older film formats and notable contributors, signaling potential preferences for classic cinema retrospectives or discussions. 

In summary, this user favors classic dramas with historical significance, values technical quality and additional contextual commentary, and approaches films with a critical yet curious mindset.
